availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Brunk (Larue County and Hardin Co, KY, postmaster & merchant)

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, postmaster and merchant. Grayson County, Kentucky, native. Married to Sallie Williams Brunk in Hardin County, Kentucky, on May 2, 1855. Father of Elizabeth "Bettie" H. Brunk and Jane "Jennie" Brunk. Postmaster of Big Clifty in Grayson County from December 6, 1850, to January 27, 1851.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Sonora, p. 425A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994037, Hardin County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994037, Hardin County Marriages.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Hardin County, Kentucky, vol. 14, p. 630.
"T. J. Brunk (1820-1906)," Find A Grave, Memorial #111074899, accessed May 4, 2018, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111074899.
